title: How to get my philosophical ideas recognized - Quora

response.answer_text: Before anything, have your ideas organized in writing form, as precise as you can. And, as Philosophy requires it, bullet-proofed and ready to receive critics, questions and challenges. Now... Make sure thay they are not already someone's else ideas. There's rarely now anything new under Philosophy´s sun.Start a blog. Call for feedbacks from passionate philosophy readers. They might be a precious help to know where to situate your ideas.Get yours words out on Quora. Surely there is a question asked where your ideas can make up a part of an answer?Check if your city doesn't host in Philosophical cafés or Book clubs that might allow you to meet people to discuss your ideas.Try to see the options at your local university to follow philosophy classes or take up a degree; academia will put you in contact with the people able to recongnize the validity and novelty of your ideas.If they are already under a book form, send it to specialized publisher, two, three, ten if needed, and ask for feedbacks. If it is an article, to specialized philosophy magazines.Keep us update!

A huge number of people (including me!) have philosophical ideas that few pay attention to. I think there are several routes to gaining more exposure. One is to write a book, e.g. a Kindle book, which anyone can write and upload. But for many people to actually read it, it will have to be on a topic that really interests people and will have to be engagingly written and carefully titled. You could go the academic route, get a degree and a Ph.D. and try to become a philosophy professor. Or you could go the Internet route, create a website, make YouTube videos or a podcast and commit yourself to putting those ideas out there over an extended period of time, gradually building up an audience. Stefan Molyneux has done this, for instance. Out of the things that I've tried myself, my podcast has probably been the most successful so far, gaining a few thousand views with around ten episodes. So not very successful, but OK for a niche topic and not much effort. If you can also make tutorials on a related topic, that could really get you heard on a large scale. But they have to be tutorials on something people are looking for tutorials about, and it will have to connect closely to your philosophical ideas if you want some of those people to move on to consuming your ideas.
